## About

Keya Saxena is a PhD candidate in the School of Journalism and Communication and an instructor in the Department of Women, Gender & Sexuality Studies at the University of Oregon. Originally from New Delhi, Keya brings a critical cultural perspective to her work, weaving together themes of communication, social justice, and gender with a keen focus on transnational contexts. For her doctoral research, she specializes in the use of stand-up comedy as a tool for social justice. 

Prior to pursuing her PhD, Keya worked in strategic communications with the United Nations in Switzerland and India, focusing on social protection, child marriage, adolescent reproductive health, gender equity, and menstrual health management.
